title: Augusta County: John Scott to Samuel Hunt, January 11, 1866
summary: Anxious to start an "Industrial School" for blacks in Staunton, Scott remarks that the growth in the number of students attending elementary schools precludes the establishment of specialized institutions in the city, as teachers cannot be spared. He adds that the community is in desperate need of material assistance from the AMA, commenting on the deplorable living conditions of many black families.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Race Relations, Women, Economy, American Civil War
